Nuclear power is set to reach 100 GW by 2047. These goals balance energy needs with climate commitments and economic development.

items.summary: According to the paper, investments in urban mobility infrastructure over the past decade, particularly metro rail expansion, have translated into stronger household liquidity management and more disciplined borrowing.

items.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 4.8% in December
items.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in December, reaching 4.8 percent from 4.7 percent in November. This rise was driven by joblessness in urban areas, while rural unemployment remained steady. The overall jobless rate for men and women also edged up. Youth unemployment experienced a small increase.

items.title: Hotel industry sees more room for deals, investments this year
items.summary: Indian hotel deals reached $397 million in 2025, a rise from the previous year. This growth signals strong demand for travel. Projections show further increases in transaction volumes for 2026. India is poised to attract substantial hospitality sector investments by 2028. Strategic acquisitions and new capital are entering the market.

items.title: Jain Hedge Fund Costs Cut Into $750 Million Profits Last Year
items.summary: Running a multistrategy hedge fund is expensive. Building one from scratch is even more so.

items.title: Xreal Files Patent Suit Against Rival Smart Glasses Maker Viture
items.summary: Xreal Inc., a Chinese pioneer in smart glasses, is suing Viture Inc. for patent infringement in the US, arguing its rival has unfairly capitalized on Xreal’s extensive research and investment in the segment.

items.title: Detours at 35,000 ft: Indian airlines hit as Iran airspace closure adds to Pakistan ban woes
items.summary: Air India and IndiGo are taking new flight paths to bypass Iran's airspace. This is due to ongoing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East. These changes mean longer journeys and potential delays for passengers. The airlines are working to find the best solutions. This situation adds to existing challenges like Pakistan's airspace closure.

items.title: Rising costs eat into FY25 profit of Mondelez & Parle
items.summary: India's top packaged food firms, Parle Biscuits and Mondelez India, experienced significant profit declines in FY25 despite steady consumer demand. Soaring raw material costs, particularly for cocoa, dairy, wheat, and sugar, along with increased operational expenses, squeezed profit margins for both companies. Mondelez India saw its net profit plummet to ₹11 crore, while Parle Biscuits' net profit dropped by 39%.

items.title: Costlier memory chips may trigger price shock: Smartphone, TV and laptop prices could rise by 4–8%
items.summary: Electronics prices are set to climb. Smartphones, televisions, and laptops will see increases of up to 8% in the coming months. This follows a sharp rise in late 2023. Memory chip demand is driving these hikes. Experts predict this trend may continue quarterly. Consumers may face higher costs for essential gadgets.

items.title: Banks' credit-to-deposit ratio hits record 81.75% as mobilisation lags
items.summary: Indian banks' credit-to-deposit ratio hit an all-time high of 81.75% as of December 31, signaling pressure to attract deposits amid robust loan demand. This elevated ratio reflects challenges in deposit mobilization, with investors seeking higher returns elsewhere, and a lag in deposit growth compared to credit expansion.

items.title: McKinsey to hire Liberal Arts candidates! Consulting giant looks for creativity potential amid growing AI adoption
items.summary: McKinsey plans to recruit liberal arts graduates to enhance creativity, according to the company's global managing partner, Bob Sternfels. The firm's hiring process now includes assessments using its AI tool, Lilli, reflecting its growing integration of AI in operations and workforce management.

items.title: Aviation probe agency issues preliminary report on Dec 2025 trainer aircraft crash in MP
items.summary: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau has released a preliminary report on a trainer aircraft crash in December 2025. The Redbird Flight Training Academy aircraft experienced a loss of engine RPM during a turn onto the final approach. The instructor took control and initiated a forced landing. The aircraft struck a power cable before crashing. Both pilots sustained injuries.

items.title: Power sector can fetch $450 billion investment by 2032
items.summary: India's power sector is set for massive growth.  An investment of $450 billion is projected by 2032.  The nation has moved beyond power shortages to a surplus regime.  This transition will boost electricity generation, transmission, distribution, and energy storage.  The focus is on long-term growth, grid resilience, and clean energy integration.  This marks a significant shift for India's energy future.

items.title: Textiles & apparel exports fall in first three quarters of FY26
items.summary: Indian textile and apparel exports saw a slight dip in the first nine months of FY26. Textile shipments declined, while apparel exports showed growth. Restrictions in Bangladesh and market uncertainties in the US impacted yarn and fabric sales. Some exporters offered discounts to maintain sales volumes. Companies heavily reliant on the US for home textiles faced significant challenges.

items.title: Expecting India's 2025-26 overall exports to touch USD 850 billion: Commerce Secretary
items.summary: India is projected to surpass USD 850 billion in total exports for FY 2025-26, building on a strong performance in both merchandise and services.  For the first nine months of the fiscal year, overall exports reached USD 634.26 billion, a 4.33% increase from the previous year. The services sector continues to be the primary driver of this growth.

items.title: Making digital payment mistakes? Anil Singhvi explains how to stay safe
items.summary: QR codes and online payment links can sometimes put users in danger. If used without care, they can cause personal and financial details to leak. That is why experts say digital payments are safe only when used wisely. Being alert and informed is the key to avoiding fraud. Market guru Anil Singhvi shares tips on how users can stay safe while making digital payments.

items.title: Delhi's energy shift: Higher domestic, declining industrial power consumption; rise in PNG users
items.summary: Delhi's energy landscape is changing. Domestic electricity users have increased significantly over five years. Industrial power consumers have dropped sharply. Households are switching from LPG cylinders to piped natural gas. This shift reflects evolving energy preferences in the national capital.

This collaboration aims to boost green energy initiatives. The partnership is set to drive significant growth in the renewable sector. It aligns with NTPC's ambitious target of 60 GW by FY32.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Friday
items.summary: Domestic markets showed caution due to trade deal uncertainty, though renewed hopes emerged as negotiations restarted. Metals led gains on expectations of U.S. rate cuts and safe-haven demand. Globally, equities traded mixed as investors awaited key U.S. economic data and earnings reports.

items.title: Homebuyers' maintenance societies, RWAs can't intervene in insolvency process of developer firm: SC
items.summary: The Supreme Court has ruled that homebuyers' societies and Resident Welfare Associations cannot intervene in the insolvency proceedings of a developer company. The court clarified that only creditors with a genuine willingness to revive the corporate debtor can invoke the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. Alternative legal remedies are available for recovery.

items.title: Goolsbee says lowering inflation is US Fed's main job
items.summary: Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee emphasized the central bank's priority is reducing inflation, citing a stable job market as evidence. He indicated that interest rate cuts are possible later this year, provided there's convincing data showing a path back to the 2% inflation target. Goolsbee also defended the Fed's independence, warning against political interference that could reignite inflation.

Economists point to trade and immigration policies affecting worker supply and demand. Businesses are also cautious due to AI investments. The Federal Reserve's report indicates employment was mostly unchanged.

items.title: India's clean energy industry opposes revocation of connectivity over delays
items.summary: Renewable energy developers in India are opposing a new rule. The rule could cut off their access to power transmission lines. This would happen if they do not sign power purchase agreements quickly. Industry groups argue this is unfair for projects facing delays. They want the regulator to focus on helping developers instead of penalizing them.

This positive export trend is a welcome development.

items.title: India’s green building market to hit $85 bn by 2032; reusing furniture can cut carbon 40%
items.summary: India's green building market is set for significant growth. Reusing existing furniture offers a substantial 30-40% reduction in embodied carbon. Interior fit-outs contribute heavily to emissions, but quick wins are possible. Organizations can achieve 30-50% reductions through smart material choices and reuse. Embodied carbon is the next frontier for sustainability in construction.

items.summary: While the rural unemployment rate remained static at 3.9% during December, the urban unemployment rate edged up slightly to 6.7% from 6.5% in November, underscoring the persistent strain on these labour markets, the survey showed.

Along with the quarterly results, the company's board has also approved an interim dividend of Rs 23 per share and a stock split in the ratio of 1:10.

items.title: MSME schemes set for major overhaul as NITI Aayog pushes convergence roadmap to boost efficiency, outreach
items.summary: NITI Aayog has released a detailed roadmap to converge and streamline MSME schemes, aiming to reduce duplication, improve coordination and boost outreach. The report proposes an AI-powered centralised portal, alignment of cluster and skill programmes, stronger marketing support and cautious merging of overlapping schemes, while safeguarding targeted initiatives. The reforms are expected to simplify access for MSMEs and improve the overall impact of government support.

items.title: Printing of Budget 2026 to take place at North Block, old address of finance ministry
items.summary: Union Budget news: Budget document printing will continue at North Block. The finance ministry team has moved to Kartavya Bhawan. Printing of confidential Budget documents will remain at the old North Block press. This exercise involves staff quarantine for up to two weeks. The halwa ceremony marks the start of this quarantine. Union Budget 2026-27 will be unveiled on February 1.

items.title: Budget 2026-27: High compliance burden, limited access to capital drag manufacturing growth, as per survey

items.title: Investec, Ravi Kapoor’s SACS Partners ink India-focused pact
items.summary: Investec India has partnered with veteran banker Ravi Kapoor's SACS Partners to jointly conduct investment banking business in the country. Kapoor will serve as Vice Chairman of Investment Banking at Investec India. This collaboration aims to offer clients a superior combination of high-quality advice and world-class execution in financial advisory, M&A, and capital raising.

items.title: Spotify announces price hike for premium users in US after two years – here's what customers should know
items.summary: Spotify will increase its premium subscription price in the US. This change, affecting subscribers in Estonia and Latvia as well, follows previous price hikes in other countries. Spotify aims to maintain service quality and support artists amidst rising inflation.

items.title: Rapid metro rail expansion in the country translated into stronger household liquidity management: EAC-PM Working Paper
items.summary: A working paper, co-authored by Soumya Kanti Ghosh and Pulak Ghosh, both part-time members at the Economic Advisory Council to the PM (EAC-PM), and  Falguni Sinha, economist at SBI, said sustainable urban transport investments can strengthen household financial resilience and have direct implications for housing finance policy and lender risk assessment, suggesting that metro systems should be viewed not only as mobility or environmental interventions, but also as household balance-sheet stabilizers with implications for credit markets and systemic risk.

items.title: 75% of Indian higher education institutions still not industry-ready: Report
items.summary: A new report reveals a major gap in India's higher education. Most institutions struggle to prepare students for jobs. Curriculum often lacks industry relevance. Practical training and internships are limited. This prevents students from gaining essential job skills. Experts call for a fundamental shift to make education more industry-aligned and boost employability.

items.title: Unemployment rate rises marginally to 4.8 pc in December

items.title: L&T Technology Services Q3FY26: Revenue up 10.2%, margins improve sequentially
items.summary: Engineering services firm reports 10.2 per cent year-on-year rise in Q3FY26 revenue despite seasonal softness, while operating margins improve quarter-on-quarter amid stable deal wins and strong performance from the sustainability segment.

items.title: HDFC Life Q3 Results: Standalone profit flat at Rs 421 crore; net premium income up 9%

items.title: Budget 2026: Oil industry seeks abolition or review of OID cess on pre-NELP and nomination blocks
items.summary: As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, the oil and gas sector is calling on the government to reconsider the OID cess imposed on domestically produced crude oil. Stakeholders in the industry argue that the existing 20% ad-valorem tax is stifling production potential and should be revised. Furthermore, they suggest doing away with other taxes like NCCD and Basic Excise Duty.

items.title: Airlines continue to avoid Iran and Iraq despite airspace reopening
items.summary: Middle East tensions prompt airlines like Wizz Air and Lufthansa to avoid Iraqi and Iranian airspace, with flights rerouted over Afghanistan and Central Asia, resulting in longer journeys.

items.title: Mid-Air Turnback, Ground Impact: Air India A350 incident at IGI Airport
items.summary: The Air India A350 aircraft had been airborne from Delhi and was headed to New York when the airline got the message of the sudden closing of Iranian airspace.

items.title: India Trade Deals Update: Commerce secretary shares latest on India’s BTA and FTA talks with US, Canada, and EU

items.title: Jio Financial Q3 Results: PAT drops 9% YoY to Rs 269 crore even as revenue doubles
items.summary: Jio Financial Services posted mixed Q3FY26 results, with revenue surging 106% to Rs 901 crore but net profit falling 9% YoY to Rs 269 crore. items.title: A tough sell for Elon Musk? Tesla has a cold start in India

High import duties inflate prices, making the premium EVs uncompetitive against locally assembled rivals and feature-rich alternatives. Despite strong brand appeal, Tesla struggles to convert interest into sales in India's price-sensitive market.

items.title: Buying silver on dips? Experts decode how much glitter to add to core portfolio as white metal shines

items.title: These 13 microcap stocks crashed up to 64% in FY26. Are you affected?
items.summary: FY26 has exposed sharp divergences within the microcap space. While benchmarks remain resilient, several microcap stocks have seen steep value erosion, with select names crashing up to 64%, highlighting the risks of chasing returns in volatile segments.

They warn that lifting these rules would harm domestic manufacturing and lead to job losses. The industry is vital for thermal power plants. These non-AC, locomotive-hauled services connect various states, offering upgraded facilities and reliable connectivity for millions. The trains aim to strengthen links between eastern, northern, and southern India, prioritizing budget-friendly fares for mass transit.

items.title: A case for rethinking Sebi’s new merchant banking rules
items.summary: SEBI's new merchant banking regulations, effective January 3, 2026, aim to professionalize the sector but risk concentrating business among large entities. A growing economy requires a diverse pool of specialist merchant bankers to enable efficient capital allocation, not an oligopolistic market structure.

However, caution is advised for schemes targeting specific groups or large flagship programs.

items.title: PMS Tracker: 10 best performing PMS portfolios of 2025 with gains of up to 42%

The top 10 PMS performers highlight consistent wealth creation across diverse investment styles and asset classes.

items.summary: India's chemical market is set for massive growth, potentially reaching over $300 billion by 2030. Domestic companies are encouraged to make bold strategic decisions to capture this opportunity. Significant potential exists in sunrise sectors like semiconductors, where specialised chemicals are in high demand. Indian firms can build substantial businesses by focusing on innovation and global scale.

items.summary: Israel and India have signed a Letter of Intent to deepen cooperation in agriculture, fisheries, and the blue economy, aiming for sustainable food security. This expands their existing partnership to water agriculture, focusing on smart water management and innovation. The agreement underscores a shared vision and strengthens bilateral ties in these vital sectors.

The incident occurred upon landing in Delhi when the plane encountered a foreign object while taxiing in dense fog. This grounding may lead to disruptions on select long-haul routes. The aircraft was previously rerouted due to Iran's temporary airspace closure.

Both sides are engaged daily, aiming to conclude the deal before the leaders' summit on January 27. The benchmark Nikkei 225 fell 0.4%, while the broader Topix achieved a new all-time closing high. This mirrored a Wall Street trend where tech shares dragged down markets, with currency movements adding headwinds for Japanese firms.

Strong results from TSMC propelled ASML to record highs, while Swedbank and Richemont also saw significant gains. Other propulsion equipment for the trains is also being developed by BHEL units.

India remains a key market for Sony, aiming for a higher global ranking.

items.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra's strong SUV bookings, driven by the XUV 7XO and XEV 9S, have led Nomura to name it their top auto pick. In contrast, Nomura maintains a neutral stance on Bajaj Auto's new electric scooter, favoring Ather Energy and TVS Motor for two-wheeler growth.

items.title: India’s Russia oil trade may dip again, stranding cargoes at sea
items.summary: The Trump administration has attacked India for months over purchases of oil that Washington says are supporting President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine, and ultimately imposed punitive 50% tariffs

items.title: IT earnings recovery nowhere in sight, markets still pricey: Where Anand Tandon sees value now
items.summary: IT earnings remain under pressure as global demand stays weak, says analyst Anand Tandon. With markets still expensive, opportunities are selective in metals, PSU banks, capital goods and life insurance, while Budget tax relief looks unlikely. Here’s where investors may still find pockets of value amid earnings uncertainty and sectoral rotation.

items.title: Budget 2026 key priorities: Skilling youth for an AI-ready future
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: India, with about 65% of its population under 35, faces the twin challenge and opportunity of preparing nearly 950 million young people for a job market being reshaped by artificial intelligence. While AI is changing the scale and nature of entry-level jobs, it also offers new ways to deliver personalised, language-based learning at speed and scale.

items.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki warns of silver price crash, plans to trade white metal for gold
items.summary: Despite the warning, Kiyosaki reiterated his long-standing bullish stance on precious metals, particularly silver. He said he plans to continue buying silver even at higher prices, up to $100 an ounce, but emphasised patience in the event of a market crash.

items.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO GMP holds strong at nearly 60% as listing gets postponed
items.summary: Bharat Coking Coal IPO’s grey market premium remains near 60% despite a delay in listing due to a trading holiday. The issue saw massive investor interest, strong subscription levels, and sustained optimism ahead of the revised January 19 debut.

items.title: Microsoft signs record multi-million dollar deal to buy soil carbon credit in push to reach 2030 green goal
items.summary: Being carbon negative means Microsoft plans to ensure it facilitates more removals of carbon than the amount its operations globally emit.&nbsp;

items.title: Who holds Indian workplaces together—Glue employees. But they rarely get rewarded
items.summary: A glue player holds a team together, helps new recruits settle in and identifies the best way forward—without seeking the spotlight. Employers who formally recognize and reward such employees could count on team cohesion for superior results.

items.title: China Vanke seeks 90-day grace period extension for 2 billion yuan bond
items.summary: China Vanke is seeking to extend the grace period for a 2 billion yuan bond repayment, originally due December 15, by an additional 90 trading days. The developer also proposed a one-year deferral, using project receivables as credit enhancements, and paying overdue interest by the grace period's end. Approval would push the expiration to April 29.

items.title: Fixed income in focus ahead of Budget 2026: why bonds are back on investors’ radar
items.summary: Fixed-income markets are back in focus ahead of Budget 2026 as investors track fiscal consolidation, stable sovereign yields and global rate volatility. Experts say disciplined deficit guidance, supportive monetary conditions and potential bond index inclusion could boost confidence in both government and corporate debt, driving renewed interest in bonds.

items.title: Biocon raises ₹4,150 cr via QIP issue
items.summary: The proceeds from the QIP will be primarily utilised to meet the cash consideration payable to Mylan Inc. (Viatris) for buying out its shareholding in Biocon Biologics Ltd, including repayment of debt availed in this regard

items.title: Volume Shocker: 6 stocks see over 1 crore MF share additions in Dec’25; rally up to 20%
items.summary: Six stocks witnessed massive mutual fund buying with over 1 crore shares added in December 2025, triggering rallies of up to 20% and signalling strong institutional confidence.

items.title: Lighthouse Canton appoints Gurjeet Sohi as MD, Head of Wealth Management for India
items.summary: Lighthouse Canton strengthens its India leadership with Gurjeet Sohi as Managing Director and Head of Wealth Management. The firm aims to double assets under management to $10 billion by 2027. Sohi brings extensive experience from Deutsche Bank. This move supports Lighthouse Canton's expansion and commitment to institutional-grade wealth solutions in India.

items.title: Four stocks where promoters see value despite market volatility
items.summary: 2025 saw record promoter selling of over  ₹1.5 trillion. Yet, even as holdings fell across the market, promoters in these four stocks quietly bought more—signalling confidence amid volatility.

items.title: Air India cancels flights to US, delays Europe services due to Iran airspace closure
items.summary: The closure comes amid rising tensions between Iran and the US, raising safety concerns

items.title: Gold, silver slide from record heights on profit-taking
items.summary: Spot silver, platinum, palladium ‍all fall more than 3%

items.title: Domestic coal production accelerates 3.6% in December, although year-to-date production slips marginally
items.summary: Although, overall coal dispatch decelerated in December primarily led by a lower offtake to the power sector.

items.title: Prestige Estates Q3 sales bookings jump 39 pc to Rs 4,184 cr
items.summary: Prestige Estates Projects Ltd reported a significant 39% increase in sales bookings to Rs 4183.6 crore in Q3 FY26, driven by strong housing property demand. The company achieved record-breaking sales of Rs 22,327.3 crore in the first nine months of the fiscal year, surpassing previous full-year peaks.

items.title: Wipro Q3 Preview: Revenue may rise 4% YoY; margins under pressure
items.summary: Wipro is expected to post muted Q3 performance, with revenue rising about 4% YoY and margins remaining under pressure due to furloughs, deal ramp-up costs and acquisition integration. Brokerages see flat profit growth and limited sequential momentum, while Q4 guidance and large deal conversions will be key investor focus areas.

items.title: Fed Chair stays for now as Trump weighs successor amid Justice probe
items.summary: US President Donald Trump said he has no immediate plans to remove Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell despite a Justice Department investigation into renovation cost overruns. The probe has intensified debate over central bank independence, drawing bipartisan criticism, even as Trump considers potential successors and defends a stronger presidential role in monetary policy.

items.title: Stock market closure for a local municipal election reflects poor planning: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath
items.summary: Zerodha's CEO, Nithin Kamath, criticises the closure of Indian stock exchanges for local municipal elections, arguing it reflects poor planning and a lack of understanding of global market dynamics.&nbsp;

items.title: Amagi Media Labs IPO: GMP rises ahead of last bidding day. Should you apply?
items.summary: Amagi Media Labs IPO has seen a lukewarm response, with a 13% subscription rate as of the second day. The IPO price band is set at  ₹343-361 per share, and listing is expected on January 21, with a total issue size of  ₹1,788.6 crore.

items.title: Infosys shares to be in focus tomorrow after Q3 results. Should you buy, sell or hold the large-cap IT stock?
items.summary: Infosys ADR jumped over 10% on NYSE on Wednesday, January 14, after the company raised its constant-currency revenue growth outlook for FY26. Infosys ADR ended 10.45% higher at $19.35.

items.title: NBFCs set for strongest earnings in nine quarters. 10 stock picks from Motilal Oswal ahead of Q3 results
items.summary: NBFCs are set for their strongest earnings in nine quarters, with Motilal Oswal expecting robust Q3 growth led by steady AUM momentum, margin gains and controlled credit costs.

items.title: KKR closes $2.5 billion Asia-Pacific credit fund, deploys more than half across 10 deals
items.summary: The global investment firm’s second performing credit fund targets senior lending, capital solutions, and collateral-backed opportunities amid a booming private credit market in Asia.

items.title: US economic activity shows broad-based stability ahead of Fed meeting
items.summary: US economic activity showed broad-based stability in recent weeks, with most Federal Reserve districts reporting modest growth and steady employment, according to the latest Beige Book. Price pressures remained moderate, and markets expect the Fed to hold rates steady at its upcoming meeting as policymakers await clearer inflation trends.

items.title: India attracts $51 billion FDI amid startup, manufacturing push
items.summary: As part of its startup push, the government will host National Startup Day on January 16, launching 75 Grand Challenges and presenting 20 National Startup Awards.

items.title: Government urges corporates to deepen engagement with startups
items.summary: India has recognised over 2 lakh startups so far, supported through multiple funding schemes and incentives, with renewed focus on promoting deep-tech ventures and linking R&D labs with the startup ecosystem.

items.title: Markets jittery, but fundamentals offer comfort: Dipan Mehta
items.summary: Indian equity markets are experiencing a choppy phase, surprising investors despite intact fundamentals. Market veteran Dipan Mehta remains optimistic about the current earnings season, anticipating a potential rally beyond previous highs. He also favors wealth management firms over AMCs for financialization plays and sees a positive outlook for the IT sector driven by AI.

items.title: Oil prices drop 3% after Trump comments on Iran
items.summary: Donald Trump says he had been told the killings of protesters in Iran had been halted

items.title: Powell probe: The politics of marble could weigh heavily on the Federal Reserve as an institution
items.summary: History shows that mega projects almost always overshoot budgets. The Fed’s headquarters renovation is hardly unique. What is new about the US investigation is the threat to this central bank’s independence and the impact it could have on the dollar’s supremacy.

items.title: Bajaj Mobility AG to cut 500 jobs as part of global rightsizing initiative
items.summary: The number of employees at the company as of December 31, 2025, stood at 3,794

items.title: Military surveillance–the new lucrative front for India’s space startups
items.summary: Startups, including Pixxel and Digantara, target at least half of their business by launching satellites for defence forces in India and overseas. Experts say private startups can't simply piggyback Isro, and they will have to prove their products in space

items.title: Nomura says United Spirits is at the cusp of a developing upcycle; initiates with Buy rating. 3 reasons why
items.summary: Nomura has initiated coverage on United Spirits with a Buy rating, citing premiumisation tailwinds, easing regulatory environment and innovation-led expansion. The brokerage sees a developing upcycle and expects margin expansion, healthy earnings growth and valuation comfort.

items.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Preview: Profit set to climb despite one-time labour code charges
items.summary: Tech Mahindra is poised for steady revenue growth and improved profitability in the December quarter, driven by margin expansion and cost optimization. Brokerages anticipate a modest revenue increase of around 7% year-on-year, with profit after tax projected to surge approximately 40% YoY, outperforming many peers.

items.title: Somany Ceramics: Why do 19 of 21 analysts have a ‘buy’ on this tiles stock that shed 27% in 12 months?
items.summary: Somany Ceramics’ shares have fallen sharply amid weak tile demand and margin pressure, but brokerages remain bullish, betting on a turnaround at its loss-making Max plant and better margins.

items.title: Rs 8 lakh crore shock! Why 2026 winter is turning harsh for Sensex, Nifty and whether to buy the fear
items.summary: Indian stock markets experienced their worst start to a year in a decade, with nearly Rs 8 lakh crore in market capitalization wiped out. Foreign institutional investors have pulled out $2 billion amid anxieties over a delayed India-US tariff deal and the upcoming Union Budget. Analysts anticipate continued range-bound trading until policy clarity emerges.

items.title: 45% of Tripura-Mizoram gas pipeline project complete: Officials
items.summary: Work on the natural gas pipeline connecting Tripura and Mizoram is progressing well. Officials report 45 percent completion. The 119.5-km project is slated for completion by December 2027. This initiative will bring affordable gas to Mizoram for domestic, commercial, and industrial use.

items.title: Shadowfax Technologies IPO opens January 20; GMP, issue details, 10 key things to know
items.summary: Shadowfax Technologies IPO opens on January 20, aiming to raise  ₹1,907.3 crore. The price band is set between  ₹118 and  ₹124 per share. The company has reported significant profit growth and intends to invest in network improvements and marketing.

items.title: 5 stocks YES Securities expects to shine in 2026, with upsides up to 26%
items.summary: YES Securities believes Indian equities are entering 2026 with a structural growth tailwind despite global uncertainty. The brokerage has identified five high-conviction Buy-rated stocks, citing strong balance sheets, improving business mix and sector-specific drivers, with potential upsides of up to 26% across auto components, financials and banking.

items.title: NFRA seeks AI tools to improve financial reporting quality
items.summary: The initiative aims to generate explainable compliance reports, risk analytics and AI-driven insights for regulators

items.title: Mumbai poll holiday for BSE, NSE draws flak from Zerodha's Nithin Kamath
items.summary: Stock Market Holiday: Indian stock exchanges observed a full trading holiday on Thursday, January 15, due to municipal elections in Maharashtra. Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath criticized the closure, citing global market connectivity and poor planning. The debate intensified with Samir Arora questioning the consistency of such arguments, especially in light of markets opening on a Sunday for Budget Day.

items.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO listing delayed: Check revised allotment, refund and listing timeline
items.summary: Earlier, the company had planned to finalise allotment on January 14, initiate refunds on January 15 and list the stock on January 16.

items.title: Tesla’s India letdown spurs discounts on unsold Model Y SUVs
items.summary: The tepid India debut comes at a time when the company is seeing faltering global demand. Its worldwide sales fell in 2025 for a second consecutive year, dropping the company behind China’s BYD Co. as the top-seller of EVs.

items.title: Q3 Results Today Live: Jio Financial, HDFC Life Insurance, 360 ONE WAM, LTTS, Angel One, Emmvee Photovoltaic Power to announce Q3 results
items.summary: Q3 Results Today Live Updates: Several companies, including Jio Financial Services, HDFC Life Insurance, 360 ONE WAM, LT Technology Services, Angel One and Emmvee Photovoltaic Power, are set to announce their FY26 Q3 earnings on January 15, 2026.

items.title: Iran reopens airspace after temporary closure forced flights to reroute
items.summary: Iran's airspace reopened after a five-hour closure due to U.S.-Iran tensions. This closure impacted flights, causing cancellations and reroutes. Indian airlines like IndiGo and Air India faced disruptions. Germany also cautioned its airlines. The situation heightened risks for air travel, with several airlines avoiding Iranian airspace.

items.title: Budget 2026 and India’s bid for a rare earths power shift
items.summary: Budget 2026 Expectations: India is treating rare earths as a key strategic test case to loosen China’s grip on the sector, with the focus sharpening ahead of Budget 2026. Experts say the budget must prioritise de-risking private investment—through easier financing, tax incentives and assured offtake agreements—to scale up mining, processing and downstream manufacturing. The push is seen as critical to meeting India’s infrastructure build-out and energy transition goals.

items.title: Shadowfax IPO in focus: GMP and 10 key takeaways for investors ahead of subscription
items.summary: Shadowfax IPO is in focus as investors track the latest grey market premium (GMP) and assess 10 key factors, including valuation, growth prospects and risks, ahead of the issue’s subscription window.

items.title: Crude oil takes centre stage amid geopolitical storms, can it still offer investment opportunities?
items.summary: Crude oil prices remain volatile amid rising geopolitical risks across key regions. Analysts suggest oil is best used as a tactical hedge rather than a core investment, with energy equities offering more stable opportunities during uncertain global conditions.

items.title: Stocks to buy or sell: Osho Krishan of Angel One suggests buying Eternal, PNB shares on 16 January
items.summary: The Indian stock markets are closed on January 15 for municipal elections in Maharashtra, with trading resuming on January 16. The Sensex and Nifty 50 fell on January 14 due to geopolitical tensions and foreign fund outflows. Osho Krishan recommend buying Eternal and Punjab National Bank shares.

items.title: Gold, Silver Rate Today Highlights: Silver prices recover  ₹1,846/kg; gold down 0.08% amid profit booking pressure
items.summary: Gold, Silver Rate Today Highlights: MCX gold price hit a record high of  ₹1,43,590 per 10 grams level, while MCX silver rate touched a life-time high of  ₹2,91,406 per kg on Wednesday, led by strong demand for the precious metals.

items.title: Iran temporarily closes airspace to most flights, forcing airlines to reroute
items.summary: Air India, IndiGo among carriers affected by airspace closure

items.title: India’s financial markets closed today for holiday
items.summary: Earlier on Wednesday, the benchmarks extended losses amid U.S. tariff concerns, foreign outflows, a weaker rupee and firmer bond yields.

items.title: Toyota Industries' shares hit record as market hopes for higher buyout offer
items.summary: Shares of forklift maker Toyota Industries reached a record high today. This surge followed an improved offer from Toyota Motor. Investors are trading above the new price, anticipating an even better deal. The initial proposal faced criticism for its unclear valuation. Toyota Motor raised its bid by 15% to 18,800 yen per share. The tender period is now open.

items.title: Trip.com shares crash 22% in Hong Kong after antitrust probe
items.summary: Hong Kong-listed shares of a major Chinese online travel agency plummeted after regulators launched an antitrust probe. The company is suspected of abusing its dominant market position. Analysts suggest this could impact sentiment but not necessarily its industry standing. Potential fines could reach hundreds of millions of dollars, and divestment is also a possibility.

items.title: China sees record $1.2 trillion trade surplus despite Trump's tariffs — What led to the robust growth?
items.summary: Exports of Chinese goods to other countries picked up last month despite expectations of a slowdown, a feat given a high base of comparison from a year ago, when Trump's election win sparked panicked front-loading of orders.

items.title: An emerging markets supercycle has just begun: Shuli Ren
items.summary: Emerging markets are set for a long growth period. A weak dollar and global growth continue to support this trend. New opportunities are emerging in commodities like gold and copper. Countries like Venezuela and Saudi Arabia are opening up for investment. The AI boom is also creating demand for resources found in emerging markets, offering diverse investment potential.

items.title: Q3 results today: HDFC Life, Jio Financial among 27 companies to report earnings on Thursday
items.summary: Thursday brings Q3 earnings for 27 companies. Investors will focus on HDFC Life Insurance, Angel One, and Jio Financial Services. Key metrics to watch include demand conditions, margins, and future outlook. Brokerages anticipate steady growth for HDFC Life, while Angel One may see a mixed quarter due to regulatory shifts.

items.title: Air India, IndiGo, SpiceJet warn of flight disruptions after Iran shuts airspace
items.summary: Indian airlines, including Air India, SpiceJet and IndiGo, are experiencing international flight disruptions due to Iran's airspace closure amid heightened tensions with the United States. Flights overflying the region are being rerouted, leading to potential delays, while some cancellations are occurring where alternative routes are not feasible.

items.title: Asian shares set for weaker open, crude oil falls
items.summary: Asia's benchmark share index is poised to dip from a record high following Wall Street's decline, driven by a rotation out of expensive technology stocks. Futures for Japan, Hong Kong, and China fell as the Nasdaq 100 dropped. Oil prices also decreased after President Trump indicated Iran would halt protester killings.

items.title: As India’s passport steadily ascends global power ranking charts, let’s do all we can to strengthen it
items.summary: The Indian passport has gained power as measured by the number of countries that offer its holders entry without a prior visa. But it still has a long way to go. Perhaps this is a good time to reopen our national debate on dual citizenship.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | China’s $1.2 trillion trade surplus makes it clear Beijing isn’t slowing its export machine down
items.summary: Despite America’s tariffs and trade war theatrics, China has posted the biggest surplus any country has ever seen. As its goods flood new markets from Asia to Africa, other countries are under pressure.

items.title: Stock Market Holiday: Indian stock exchanges NSE, BSE to be closed for trading today for Maharashtra Municipal elections; Check Full List
items.summary: Indian Stock Market Holiday Today: Both exchanges issued revised circulars confirming the trading holiday. The BSE clarified that equity derivatives contracts originally scheduled to expire on January 15, were revised to expire a day earlier, on January 14.

items.title: Rising memory chip prices weigh down Dixon stock
items.summary: Dixon Technologies' stock faces pressure from rising memory chip costs and upcoming regulatory changes.  The company, a major Android handset maker, sees its stock decline.  Analysts point to government approvals, memory price surges impacting demand, and the end of the PLI scheme as key concerns.  Dixon is investing in component manufacturing and expanding capacity to navigate these challenges.

items.title: Bank holiday today, 15 January: Are banks open or closed today for Pongal, Maharashtra polls? Get state-wise list
items.summary: Bank holiday today, 15 January: Along with Pongal, the country is celebrating other festivals like Uttarayana Punyakala and Makara Sankranti, for which banks will remain closed today in some states.

items.title: Air India, IndiGo international flights impacted by Iran airspace closure
items.summary: Air India said in a statement that some flights where currently rerouting is not possible are being cancelled

items.title: Metal shares extend bull run as commodity rally shows no signs of fatigue
items.summary: Indian metal producers are seeing record stock prices. Commodity prices are rising due to global uncertainty and industrial demand. Gold and silver have seen significant gains. Copper prices are also at record highs. Analysts have mixed views, with some advising caution on overbought stocks while others expect the rally to continue.

items.title: Stock market holiday: Is Dalal Street open today or closed on BMC election day?
items.summary: Stock market holiday: BSE and NSE have announced a trading holiday on Thursday. Thus, investors must note that the Indian stock market is closed for trading today, January 15, as the BSE and NSE are shut. The trading will resume on January 16, Friday.

items.title: Elara Capital sees Nifty at 30,000 by March 2027
items.summary: Elara Capital forecasts the Nifty index to reach 30,000 by March 2027. This projection suggests a potential 17% increase from current levels. The brokerage anticipates an earnings rebound will fuel this surge. Elara favors the consumption sector, particularly premiumization themes in discretionary spending, auto, jewelry, beauty, personal care, and hotels. NBFCs, private banks, and oil marketing companies are also preferred.

items.title: Tesla’s India letdown spurs discounts on unsold Model Y SUVs
items.summary: It’s an early sign of challenges as Tesla attempts to crack the world’s third-largest passenger-vehicle market with one of its cheaper entry-level models. The carmaker, which debuted in India in July, was relying on its brand power to drive sales despite local levies touching 110% for imported cars.

items.title: Lower rates to weigh on large housing finance companies in Q3
items.summary: Housing finance companies face a challenging December quarter with slower growth and squeezed margins due to aggressive bank competition. While large firms grapple with lower rates, affordable housing lenders are expected to maintain profitability by keeping their lending rates steady. Analysts anticipate stable asset quality despite some localized stress.

items.title: Punjab & Sind, IOB plan Rs 7,000 crore share sale
items.summary: Indian Overseas Bank and Punjab & Sind Bank are set to raise ₹4,000 crore and ₹3,000 crore respectively through qualified institutional placements this quarter. IOB has secured necessary approvals and is appointing merchant bankers, while Punjab & Sind Bank will hold an EGM on January 21 to consider its equity capital raise.

items.title: Anand Rathi Share Q3 net profit up over 32%
items.summary: Anand Rathi Share and Stock Brokers reported strong financial results for the December quarter. The company's net profit surged by 32.6% compared to the previous quarter and an impressive 71.8% year-on-year. Operating revenue also saw a healthy increase of 9.2% sequentially and 21.5% from the same period last year. These figures highlight robust growth for the brokerage firm.

items.title: Sebi steps up checks on portfolio overlap in mutual fund schemes
items.summary: Sebi is checking the extent of portfolio overlap with existing strategies of the fund house applying for an NFO.

items.title: IHG Hotels sets ambitious plan to have 400 properties signed and in operation in India by 2030
items.summary: IHG CEO Elie Maalouf outlines a road map to 400 hotels in India by 2030, leveraging an asset-light model to triple the current pipeline and operational count.

items.title: Govt mulls tax breaks for green bonds in budget amid weak investor interest
items.summary: Investor interest in India's sovereign green bonds declined, prompting the government to consider tax rebates for buyers in the upcoming FY27 budget. The current fiscal year has seen low subscriptions, leading to changes in targets and potential strategies to improve liquidity for green projects.

items.title: Large deal wins power Infosys Q3 performance; labour code impact weighs on margins
items.summary: Infosys secured significant large deals in the December quarter, exceeding revenue expectations.  A one-time impact from labor code changes affected profits. The company also increased its FY26 revenue growth forecast.  This follows positive results from peers like TCS and HCL Tech.  Clients are adopting new AI technology platforms.  Infosys saw its headcount rise and attrition rates fall.

items.title: The Gentari stake sale gets cracking. Will Actis, Macquarie and Sembcorp bid?
items.summary: This weaves into the larger playbook adopted by global energy majors operating in India who have either cashed out fully or are looking to monetise their business given the high valuations and growth potential in India.

items.title: US, Europe dominate FPI flows, Singapore & Mauritius lose out
items.summary: Overseas capital in Indian equities has shifted structurally, with US and European investors now dominating over traditional tax havens like Mauritius. Tighter tax norms and regulatory disclosures, including the principal purpose test and beneficial ownership rules, have reduced the appeal of Mauritius, leading to significant withdrawals from Indian equities in 2025.

items.title: Foreign fashion labels fade, functional clothing the fad
items.summary: Indian fashion retail sees a split. Uniqlo and Nike are booming, driven by quality and function. Other brands like Marks & Spencer and Adidas are struggling. Consumers are becoming more selective. This indicates a structural shift in the market. India's young population and growing appreciation for functional clothing are key factors. The market is recovering post-festive season.

items.title: Global unemployment remains unchanged, ILO warns about decrease in jobs for youth, women
items.summary: In 2015 and 2025, the share of workers living in extreme poverty declined by only 3.1 percentage points, to 7.9%, compared with a decline of 15 percentage points in the previous decade

items.title: Loan-deposit ratio to stay high, banks set to go for CDs, bonds
items.summary: The pace of rise in bank profitability is likely to bottom out this fiscal year, and gradually improve in FY27 as funding pressures ease and net interest margins (NIMs) stabilise, the agency said in its outlook on the financial sector for FY27.

items.title: Risky Borrowers Flood Market to Tap Investor Hunger for Yield
items.summary: While the broader markets have flinched at every political tremor, the world of risky debt is acting like almost nothing’s wrong.

items.title: JPMorgan and Citi Aren’t Feeling the Affordability Crisis
items.summary: If Americans are gripped by an affordability crisis, its biggest banks aren’t seeing it. Consumer spending is growing, people are saving and investing too, while losses on bad credit cards are falling. It’s a puzzle when paired with the poor sentiment reported in surveys and a drumbeat of complaints about high prices, but in the eyes of lenders, at least, the economic outlook for 2026 appears strong.

items.title: ​Moving on: On India’s Consumer Price Index and a new base year

items.title: Hong Kong emerges key market for India's high-value exports
items.summary: India's exports to Hong Kong are surging. Shipments of silver jewellery, electronics, and processed stones have seen substantial growth. Cut and polished diamonds are leading this increase. This trend highlights Hong Kong's growing importance as a trading hub for India. Diversification of exports is a key factor. Electronics and silver jewellery exports have more than doubled.

items.title: Swedbank Says US DOJ Closes Probe Into Bank Without Enforcement
items.summary: The US Department of Justice closed its investigation into Swedbank AB without an enforcement action, bringing an almost seven-year money-laundering probe nearer to a conclusion.

items.title: Wholesale inflation hits 8-month high of 0.8% in December
items.summary: Wholesale prices have exited deflation. Inflation reached an eight-month high of 0.83% in December. This shift was driven by stable food prices and rising costs for manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw an increase. Experts note base effects and stable prices contributed to the wholesale inflation rate. The commerce ministry highlighted increases in various manufacturing sectors.

items.title: Indian Overseas Bank Q3 net surges 56% to ₹1,365 crore
Tiger Global's treaty 'abuse' case key to how money flows to India
items.summary: International investors await a crucial Supreme Court verdict on Tiger Global's tax case. This ruling will significantly impact how foreign funds structure their investments in India. The decision could redefine tax implications for indirect transfers and the validity of tax residency certificates. Investors are closely watching for clarity on tax rules and their potential impact on future investment decisions.

items.title: Mahindra XEV 9S and XUV 7XO record 93,689 bookings worth ₹20,500 crore

New forex risk capital rules from April 2027

These updates aim to align Indian regulations with global Basel standards, simplifying calculations by merging offshore and onshore positions. The move also includes treating gold separately and exempting certain structural forex holdings, ensuring consistent application across all financial institutions.

items.title: Finance Ministry launches ₹20 lakh Paripoorna Mediclaim Ayush Bima for CGHS beneficiaries
items.summary: Available as a retail product, the policy provides in-patient hospitalisation coverage within India with flexible co-payment options and discounted premiums

items.title: DFS launches composite salary account package for central government employees
items.summary: Key features include accident insurance, zero-balance salary accounts, concessional loan rates and enhanced card benefits such as lounge access and cashback

items.title: RBI proposes changes to banks' forex positions
items.summary: The amendments focus on the net open position, which measures banks’ exposure to currency fluctuations.

items.title: Infosys beats revenue estimates in Q3, sees demand recovery gathering pace
items.summary: Infosys Ltd exceeded revenue expectations for the December quarter, reporting $5.1 billion. Despite margin pressures, it raised its full-year guidance to 3-3.5%.&nbsp;

items.title: Dr Reddy’s launches generic antihistamine eye drops in the US
items.summary: This launch adds to its current portfolio in the OTC eye-care space, including Olopatadine Hydrochloride Ophthalmic Solution

items.title: Apeda  resumes rice export registration to the Philippines, Senegal after import curbs lifted
items.summary: APEDA resumes non-Basmati rice exports to the Philippines and Senegal after lifting import restrictions.

items.title: EPC boom powers Waaree Renewable’s Q3 profit up 124% to ₹120 crore

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
items.summary: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.
